dagger.name: Dagger
dagger.description: A small knife with a pointed blade.

handaxe.name: Handaxe
handaxe.description: A light axe designed for one-handed use.

javelin.name: Javelin
javelin.description: A light spear designed for throwing.

light_hammer.name: Light Hammer
light_hammer.description: A light hammer designed for one-handed use.

mace.name: Mace
mace.description: A metal club with a heavy head.

quarterstaff.name: Quarterstaff
quarterstaff.description: A wooden staff that can be wielded with one or two hands.

sickle.name: Sickle
sickle.description: A curved blade attached to a short handle.

spear.name: Spear
spear.description: A simple polearm with a pointed tip.

light_crossbow.name: Light Crossbow
light_crossbow.description: A small crossbow that fires bolts.

dart.name: Dart
dart.description: A small, weighted projectile designed for throwing.

shortbow.name: Shortbow
shortbow.description: A small bow that fires arrows.

sling.name: Sling
sling.description: A simple leather strap used to hurl small projectiles.

battleaxe.name: Battleaxe
battleaxe.description: A heavy axe designed for combat.

flail.name: Flail
flail.description: A metal weight attached to a handle by a chain.

glaive.name: Glaive
glaive.description: A polearm with a large, curved blade on the end.

greataxe.name: Greataxe
greataxe.description: A large, heavy axe designed for two-handed use.

greatsword.name: Greatsword
greatsword.description: A large sword designed for two-handed use.

longsword.name: Longsword
longsword.description: A versatile sword designed for one or two-handed use.

rapier.name: Rapier
rapier.description: A slender, pointed sword designed for thrusting.

scimitar.name: Scimitar
scimitar.description: A curved sword with a sharp edge on the convex side.

shortsword.name: Shortsword
shortsword.description: A small sword designed for one-handed use.

longbow.name: Longbow
longbow.description: A large bow that fires arrows with great force.

heavy_crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
heavy_crossbow.description: A large crossbow that fires bolts with great force.

hand_crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
hand_crossbow.description: A small, one-handed crossbow that's easy to conceal.

blowgun.name: Blowgun
blowgun.description: A simple tube for firing small darts.

net.name: Net
net.description: A net used to restrain creatures. A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until freed.

padded.name: Padded Armor
padded.description: Armor made of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

studded_leather.name: Studded Leather Armor
studded_leather.description: Armor made of tough leather reinforced with close-set rivets.

hide.name: Hide Armor
hide.description: Armor made of thick furs and pelts.

chain_shirt.name: Chain Shirt
chain_shirt.description: Armor made of interlocking metal rings worn over a layer of padding.

scale_mail.name: Scale Mail
scale_mail.description: Armor consisting of a coat and leggings of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal.

breastplate.name: Breastplate
breastplate.description: Armor consisting of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather.

half_plate.name: Half Plate
half_plate.description: Armor consisting of shaped metal plates that cover most of the body.

ring_mail.name: Ring Mail
ring_mail.description: Armor made of leather with heavy rings sewn into it.

chain_mail.name: Chain Mail
chain_mail.description: Armor made of interlocking metal rings worn over a layer of quilted fabric.

splint.name: Splint Armor
splint.description: Armor made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather.

plate.name: Plate Armor
plate.description: Armor consisting of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body.

shield.name: Shield
shield.description: A wooden or metal shield carried in one hand.

helmet.name: Helmet
helmet.description: A protective covering for the head.

hat.name: Hat
hat.description: A fashionable or practical head covering.

circlet.name: Circlet
circlet.description: A decorative band worn around the head.

amulet.name: Amulet
amulet.description: A pendant worn around the neck, often for decoration or as a symbol.

necklace.name: Necklace
necklace.description: A decorative chain or string of beads worn around the neck.

scarf.name: Scarf
scarf.description: A length of fabric worn around the neck for warmth or decoration.

cloak.name: Cloak
cloak.description: A loose outer garment worn over the shoulders.

mantle.name: Mantle
mantle.description: A loose sleeveless cloak or shawl.

gloves.name: Gloves
gloves.description: Coverings for the hands with separate parts for each finger.

gauntlets.name: Gauntlets
gauntlets.description: Armored gloves that protect the hands and wrists.

bracers.name: Bracers
bracers.description: Armor pieces that protect the forearms.

belt.name: Belt
belt.description: A strip of leather or cloth worn around the waist.

sash.name: Sash
sash.description: A long strip of cloth worn around the waist or over the shoulder.

boots.name: Boots
boots.description: Sturdy footwear that covers the foot and ankle.

sandals.name: Sandals
sandals.description: Open footwear consisting of a sole held to the foot by straps.

burglar.name: Burglar's Pack
burglar.description: Includes a backpack, a bag of 1,000 ball bearings, 10 feet of string, a bell, 5 candles, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, a hooded lantern, 2 flasks of oil, 5 days rations, a tinderbox, a waterskin, and 50 feet of hempen rope.

diplomat.name: Diplomat's Pack
diplomat.description: Includes a chest, 2 cases for maps and scrolls, a set of fine clothes, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a lamp, 2 flasks of oil, 5 sheets of paper, a vial of perfume, sealing wax, and soap.

dungeoneer.name: Dungeoneer's Pack
dungeoneer.description: Includes a backpack, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, 10 torches, a tinderbox, 10 days of rations, a waterskin, and 50 feet of hempen rope.

explorer.name: Explorer's Pack
explorer.description: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, a mess kit, a tinderbox, 10 torches, 10 days of rations, a waterskin, and 50 feet of hempen rope.

thieves_tools.name: Thieves' Tools
thieves_tools.description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.

herbalism_kit.name: Herbalism Kit
herbalism_kit.description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists.

healers_kit.name: Healer's Kit
healers_kit.description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses.

healing_potion.name: Potion of Healing
healing_potion.description: A character who drinks this magical red fluid regains 2d4 + 2 hit points.

antitoxin.name: Antitoxin
antitoxin.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour.

alchemist_supplies.name: Alchemist's Supplies
alchemist_supplies.description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue alchemy. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

brewer_supplies.name: Brewer's Supplies
brewer_supplies.description: These special tools include the items needed for brewing. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

calligrapher_supplies.name: Calligrapher's Supplies
calligrapher_supplies.description: These special tools include the items needed for calligraphy. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

carpenter_tools.name: Carpenter's Tools
carpenter_tools.description: These special tools include the items needed for carpentry. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

cartographer_tools.name: Cartographer's Tools
cartographer_tools.description: These special tools include the items needed for mapmaking. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

jeweler_tools.name: Jeweler's Tools
jeweler_tools.description: These special tools include the items needed for working with precious stones and metals. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

leatherworker_tools.name: Leatherworker's Tools
leatherworker_tools.description: These special tools include the items needed for working with leather. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

smith_tools.name: Smith's Tools
smith_tools.description: These special tools include the items needed for metalworking. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using them.

bagpipes.name: Bagpipes
bagpipes.description: A wind instrument that produces sound when air is forced through pipes.

drum.name: Drum
drum.description: A percussion instrument that produces sound when struck.

dulcimer.name: Dulcimer
dulcimer.description: A stringed instrument that produces sound when strings are struck with small hammers.

flute.name: Flute
flute.description: A wind instrument that produces sound when air is blown across a hole.

lute.name: Lute
lute.description: A stringed instrument that produces sound when strings are plucked.

horn.name: Horn
horn.description: A wind instrument that produces sound when air is blown through it.

dice_set.name: Dice Set
dice_set.description: A set of various dice used for games of chance.

playing_card_set.name: Playing Card Set
playing_card_set.description: A set of cards used for games of chance.

chess_set.name: Chess Set
chess_set.description: A board and pieces used for playing chess.

backpack.name: Backpack
backpack.description: A backpack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

bedroll.name: Bedroll
bedroll.description: A portable, padded mat for sleeping.

rope_hempen.name: Hempen Rope (50 feet)
rope_hempen.description: Rope has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

rope_silk.name: Silk Rope (50 feet)
rope_silk.description: Stronger than hempen rope, silk rope has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

torch.name: Torch
torch.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

waterskin.name: Waterskin
waterskin.description: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

rations.name: Rations (1 day)
rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

lantern_hooded.name: Hooded Lantern
lantern_hooded.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

lantern_bullseye.name: Bullseye Lantern
lantern_bullseye.description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

oil_flask.name: Oil (flask)
oil_flask.description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact.

tinderbox.name: Tinderbox
tinderbox.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder used to kindle a fire.

grappling_hook.name: Grappling Hook
grappling_hook.description: A metal hook attached to a rope, used for climbing or grabbing distant objects.

hammer.name: Hammer
hammer.description: A simple tool used for pounding nails or breaking small objects.

piton.name: Piton
piton.description: A metal spike that can be driven into a wall or cliff to serve as an anchor point.

crowbar.name: Crowbar
crowbar.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

mirror_steel.name: Mirror, Steel
mirror_steel.description: A polished steel mirror useful for grooming, signaling, or looking around corners.

spyglass.name: Spyglass
spyglass.description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

lock.name: Lock
lock.description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check.

manacles.name: Manacles
manacles.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping requires a DC 20 Dexterity check.

component_pouch.name: Component Pouch
component_pouch.description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells.

holy_symbol.name: Holy Symbol
holy_symbol.description: A representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus.

holy_water.name: Holy Water (flask)
holy_water.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage.

acid_vial.name: Acid (vial)
acid_vial.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

alchemist_fire.name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
alchemist_fire.description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

ball_bearings.name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
ball_bearings.description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls to cover a 10-foot-square area. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

bell.name: Bell
bell.description: A small bell that rings when shaken.

blanket.name: Blanket
blanket.description: A cloth covering used for warmth or protection.

book.name: Book
book.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures.

caltrops.name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
caltrops.description: As an action, you can spread a bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage.

candle.name: Candle
candle.description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

chain.name: Chain (10 feet)
chain.description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

chalk.name: Chalk (1 piece)
chalk.description: A piece of chalk used for writing on hard surfaces.

climbers_kit.name: Climber's Kit
climbers_kit.description: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself.

fishing_tackle.name: Fishing Tackle
fishing_tackle.description: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

hourglass.name: Hourglass
hourglass.description: A timepiece that measures the passage of time by the flow of sand.

hunting_trap.name: Hunting Trap
hunting_trap.description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving.

ink.name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
ink.description: A bottle of ink used for writing.

ink_pen.name: Ink Pen
ink_pen.description: A pen used for writing with ink.

magnifying_glass.name: Magnifying Glass
magnifying_glass.description: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite.

mess_kit.name: Mess Kit
mess_kit.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

paper.name: Paper (one sheet)
paper.description: A sheet of paper used for writing.

parchment.name: Parchment (one sheet)
parchment.description: A sheet of parchment used for writing.

perfume.name: Perfume (vial)
perfume.description: A vial of perfume used for scenting.

poison_basic.name: Poison, Basic (vial)
poison_basic.description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage.

sealing_wax.name: Sealing Wax
sealing_wax.description: Wax used to seal letters and documents.

signet_ring.name: Signet Ring
signet_ring.description: A ring with a unique symbol used to make a seal in wax.

soap.name: Soap
soap.description: A bar of soap used for cleaning.

spellbook.name: Spellbook
spellbook.description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

tent.name: Tent, Two-person
tent.description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

whetstone.name: Whetstone
whetstone.description: A stone used to sharpen blades.
